perturbation.original_text: 2.2 Independent Contractor. The Parties expressly understand and agree that Operator is acting and shall perform and execute the provisions of this Agreement as an independent contractor unrelated to Owner or any Owner Affiliate, and the work performed by Operator hereunder shall be subject to Owner's general right of inspection and approval. Nothing in this Agreement is intended to create a relationship, expressed or implied, of employer-employee or principal-agent between Owner and Operator or between Owner and any individual employed or provided to work hereunder by Operator.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2 Independent Contractor. The Parties expressly understand and agree that Operator is acting and shall perform and execute the provisions of this Agreement as a general worker related to Owner or any Owner Affiliate, and the work performed by Operator hereunder shall be subject to Owner's general right of direction. Nothing in this Agreement is intended to create a relationship, expressed or implied, of employer-employee or principal-agent between Owner and Operator or between Owner and any individual employed or provided to work hereunder by Operator.
perturbation.explanation: The term "independent contractor" is replaced with "general worker". This creates a contradiction because the agreement initially defines the Operator as an independent entity, but then refers to them as a “general worker,” implying a different level of control and potentially misclassifying their employment status under labor laws. The change from “right of inspection and approval” to “right of direction” further increases Owner’s control.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Labor Law - Independent Contractor vs. Employee Classification

perturbation.original_text: 4.1.7 Environmental Laws. Operator shall comply, in the performance of its duties and responsibilities hereunder, in all respects with all Environmental Laws and all Environmental Permits.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1.7 Environmental Laws. Operator shall attempt to comply, in the performance of its duties and responsibilities hereunder, in some respects with some Environmental Laws and some Environmental Permits.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "shall comply, in all respects with all" to "shall attempt to comply, in some respects with some” significantly weakens the Operator's obligation to adhere to Environmental Laws and Permits. The original text creates a clear contractual obligation that is consistent with legal requirements. The modified version makes compliance discretionary and partial, creating uncertainty and potential legal issues. This contradicts the strict liability often associated with Environmental Laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Environmental Protection Laws - Strict Liability for Violations

perturbation.original_text: 8.6 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by, construed, and enforced in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to choice of law principles that would require the application of the laws of any other jurisdiction.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be interpreted following the laws of the parties involved, without regard to principles that would require the application of the laws of any jurisdiction.
perturbation.explanation: Changing “State of Delaware” to “the laws of the parties involved” creates a legal contradiction. Contract law dictates that a specific jurisdiction's laws should govern the interpretation and enforcement of the contract. This is crucial for predictability and dispute resolution. The modified clause introduces ambiguity and makes the agreement unenforceable, as it is unclear which laws should be applied. The removal of a specific jurisdiction and addition of 'parties involved' are contradictory and undermine the purpose of a governing law clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability of Governing Law Clauses
